newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks erase early gains to end lower.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks erase early gains to end lower.

text.p: Madrid stock indices erased early gains in afternoon trade to end largely unchanged on Friday with Wall Street losses weighing on shares.
The general index up 0.05 points, 0.01 percent, 467.59 and the Ibex-35 rose 2.24 points, 0.04 percent, 5,357.70.
Dealers said the expiry of March Ibex futures had little influence on stocks.
"The market lost its confidence and erased initial gains and the weak opening on Wall Street hasn't helped," one dealer said.
Telefonica was again the most actively-traded stock with more than eight million shares traded. It ended 10 pesetas higher at 3,375.
In the banking sector, most stocks experienced gains, except Banesto which fell 35 pesetas to 1,100.
Adolfo Dominguez slipped lower again, ending off 70 pesetas to 4,750 after its fourth day of trading.
